Position: Global Programmes Director

Remuneration: Competitive, negotiable

Working hours: 40 hours per week

Reports to: Global COO

Line reports: 4 Global team members – Senior Programmes

Manager, GESSI Manager, Education Specialist, MEAL Manager

Type of contract: Full time, renewable

Location: Kathmandu, Nepal. International and local travel required.

Role summary

This is a newly created leadership role, introduced as part of UWS’ evolving organisational strategy to strengthen the impact, coherence, and sustainability of its global programmes. The Global Programmes Director will play a central role in shaping and driving this strategy, providing expert leadership across UWS’ multi-country education portfolio.

The role will lead strategic programme design and delivery, ensure strong institutional and donor alignment, and drive consistent, high-quality education outcomes across diverse low-resource contexts. Working closely with country teams, partners, governments, and donors, the postholder will bring deep expertise in education and international development to translate strategic ambition into meaningful, measurable impact for children and communities.

The postholder will act as an international development thought leader, bringing sector expertise and insights to inform UWS strategy, influence external stakeholders, and communicate innovative approaches across the organisation. They will also champion an inclusive, values-driven culture and advance the localisation agenda. Flexibility and willingness to travel domestically and internationally are essential to effectively support UWS programmes. International travel is expected to be approximately 4-6 trips per year, typically lasting 1-2 weeks, including stays in remote or challenging locations.

Key tasks and responsibilities

Strategic Leadership: Shape and deliver mission-aligned programme strategies, budgeting, and operational plans. Ensure cohesive programme quality and global coherence, integrating insights across countries.

Capacity Strengthening: Build the capability of country teams to lead planning, delivery, and adaptive management—prioritising local ownership and reducing dependency.

ABOUT THE ROLE

Institutional Project Delivery: Lead institutional-level planning for large-scale, multi[1]stakeholder education initiatives. Coordinate capacity development, alignment with government systems, and donor expectations.
Fundraising & Donor Relations : Work closely with fundraising teams to design compelling proposals and cultivation strategies, support donor engagement, and proactively manage grants.
MEAL Systems: Embed robust frameworks for monitoring, evaluation, accountability, and learning. Promote evidence-driven adaptation, quality assurance, and results-based reporting.
Global Learning & Knowledge Sharing: Facilitate cross-country exchange of best practices, evidence, and innovations to strengthen programme quality globally.
Inclusion & Safeguarding: Champion gender, disability inclusion, and child protection across programmes. Maintain compliance and accountability systems.

Partnerships & Advocacy: Build strategic alliances with governments, NGOs, and institutions. Represent UWS in regional forums and contribute to programme advocacy.
Team Leadership: Provide inclusive, coaching-focused leadership. Develop staff capacity and drive organisational learning and cohesion across functions.
Thought Leadership & Innovation: Drive UWS’ strategic insight by staying abreast of emerging trends, best practices, and innovative approaches in international development, ensuring the organisation remains forward-thinking, adaptive, and at the forefront of sector developments.
Driving Inclusive Culture: Champion UWS’ evolving culture by fostering inclusivity, advancing localisation, and modelling the values and behaviours that inspire high-performing, equitable teams and programmes.

ABOUT YOU

EXPERIENCE, KNOWLEDGE & COMPETENCIES

  • 5+ years’ senior leadership in the education sector, including significant experience in international programme development, management and delivery.
  • Advanced degree in Education, International Development, Public Policy, or equivalent experience
  • Proven success in co-design and delivery of multi-country or large-scale institutional programmes in low-resource contexts.
  • Experience supporting fundraising and maintaining strong donor relations (institutional donors preferred).
  • Strong leadership in adaptive programme management and applying learning to scale.
  • Track record in safeguarding and inclusive education programming.
  • Excellent strategic, operational, and financial management skills.
  • Strong influencing and stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability to build strategic partnerships across diverse contexts.
  • Experience in public speaking and representing an organisation externally.
  • Data literacy and the ability to use evidence to inform programme strategy and demonstrate impact.
  • Fluency in English; other local languages valued.
  • Willing to travel to remote sites

Every individual at UWS needs to:

  • Be committed to the UWS vision, mission and values and apply them in their daily behaviour and work.
  • Be committed to undertaking UWS’ safeguarding training and adhering to relevant policies, to ensure everyone who comes into contact with UWS is as safe as possible.

HOW TO APPLY

Application process

Send your CV and a cover letter (max. 2 pages) outlining your suitability to recruitment@uwsglobal.net by 8th February.

Application guidelines

  • Please include “Global Programmes Director” in the email header.
  • Please attach your cover letter as a separate document (applications with cover letters in the email body will not be considered).
  • Please include your salary expectations in your cover letter.
  • You must declare if you know anyone at UWS.
  • UWS is a safe recruitment employer.

Selection process: Expect to hear by w.c. 16 February. 1 technical round, followed by 2 panel interviews

UWS is committed to the safeguarding of children, and ensuring we recruit safely is central to this commitment. All applicants will be required to undertake a DBS (Disclosure and Barring Service) check (or country-equivalent background check) as a condition of employment. UWS is an equal opportunity employer and commits to treating all applicants fairly. We actively promote diversity and inclusion and encourage applications from under- represented groups. We oppose all forms of unlawful and unfair discrimination on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation.

Position: Global MEAL Officer

Remuneration: USD 12,000 per annum

Working hours: 40 hours per week

Reports to: Global MEAL Manager

Type of contract: Full-time, renewable

Location: Kathmandu, Nepal. International and local travel required

Role summary

UWS is looking to strengthen its MEAL systems as we embark on an ambitious 2030 Programme Strategy founded on our mission of empowering children in marginalised rural communities by ensuring foundational learning.

The Global MEAL Officer will be instrumental in assessing progress against the 2030 Programme Strategy, in particular, ensuring the robust assessment of student foundational learning outcomes. They will work closely with Country MEAL Leads and the Global MEAL team, across 4 countries: Cambodia, Nepal, Myanmar and Madagascar.

The post-holder should have experience in designing baseline, mid-line and end-line evaluations within the education sector, preferably using foundational literacy and numeracy assessment tools. They will be detail-oriented, a good communicator, and have excellent data analytical and visualisation skills. Experience working within diverse and international teams will be an asset.

The introduction of this role will be a catalyst to improve the impact measurement of the UWS programmes. This will drive the quality of programme delivery and also generate evidence to contribute to successful funding proposals – all of which will compound to grow the impact and reach of UWS programmes to help realise our vision of Zero Education Poverty

Key tasks and responsibilities

Impact, research and evaluation (50%)

  • Oversee the quality of country evaluations on student learning outcomes and teaching quality, ensuring data integrity, accurate statistical analysis and maximum insights
  • Oversee the quality of briefs/reports developed by country MEAL teams on key outcome areas (e.g. learning, retention, national assessments, surveys), ensuring they inform programme improvement and learning
  • Oversee the development of UWS MEAL quarterly and annual impact reports
  • Develop standard procedures, guidelines and training for internal and external MEAL reports
  • Design and oversee regular small-scale qualitative studies to receive feedback and inputs from all stakeholders
  • Develop learning initiatives to understand different education interventions to accelerate the attainment of outcomes

Knowledge and Learning Management (30%)

  • Develop learning briefs on key outcome areas and processes
  • Develop learning platforms, in-country and globally, to share insights and trends from MEAL data
  • Design systems and procedures for high-quality information and knowledge management
  • Design and implement feedback and response mechanisms and learning-to-action initiatives with project stakeholders

Capacity Building (20%)

  • Provide training and capacity building to UWS teams.
  • Strengthen Monitoring & Evaluation practices at the school-level through the development of a capacity building programme for school-stakeholder (head teachers) on data collection, verification, usage and EMIS systems
  • Please note, this is not an exhaustive list, and other duties may be required in agreement with your line manager.

EXPERIENCE, KNOWLEDGE & COMPETENCIES

ESSENTIAL

  • Bachelor’s degree in data analytics, economics, international development, education, computer science or a related field.
  • Proficient in data collection, verification, cleaning, and analysis with advanced skills in Microsoft Excel.
  • Proven experience in database management.
  • Familiarity with Kobo Toolbox and a statistical software (SPSS, STATA, R).
  • Proven experience in conducting project baseline, mid-line and end-line evaluations, preferably using foundational literacy and numeracy assessments.
  • Experience in MEAL/M&E within the education development field.
  • Ability to produce high-quality reports, proposals, presentations and other communications to a range of current and potential stakeholders.
  • Ability to research, set up and train others in new systems and procedures for MEAL/M&E.
  • Previous experience working with external consultants.
  • Strong relationship-building skills with proven ability to liaise with a diverse range of stakeholders and colleagues.
  • Ability to think and work strategically, take initiative and lead teams with confidence.
  • Able to work and prioritise tasks to meet tight deadlines.
  • Committed to life-long learning and personal professional development.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.

DESIRABLE

  • Familiarity with PowerBI and Canva.
  • Experience in developing knowledge management systems, learning platforms and community feedback-and-response mechanisms.
  • Familiar with Outcome Harvesting and Most Significant Change approaches.

HOW TO APPLY

Application process

Send your CV and a cover letter (max. 2 pages) in English outlining your suitability to recruitment@uwsglobal.net by 14th February.

Application guidelines

  • Please include “Global MEAL Officer” in the email header.
  • Please attach your cover letter as a separate document (applications with cover letters in the email body will not be considered).
  • You must declare if you know anyone at UWS.
  • You should give the details of two references, one of whom should be your current (or most recent) employer. References will only be taken once your express permission has been granted.

Selection process: Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. UWS reserves the right to close the recruitment process early if a suitable candidate is identified. There will be a technical round followed by a panel interview.

Every individual at UWS needs to:

  • Be committed to the UWS vision, mission and values and apply them in their daily behaviour and work.
  • Be committed to undertaking UWS’ safeguarding training and adhering to relevant policies, to ensure everyone who comes into contact with UWS is as safe as possible.

UWS is committed to the safeguarding of children, and ensuring we recruit safely is central to this commitment. All applicants will be required to undertake a DBS (Disclosure and Barring Service) check (or country-equivalent background check) as a condition of employment. UWS is an equal opportunity employer and commits to treating all applicants fairly. We actively promote diversity and inclusion and encourage applications from underrepresented GLOBAL MEAL OFFICER groups. We oppose all forms of unlawful and unfair discrimination on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation.

ABOUT FWEAN

Federation of Woman Entrepreneurs’ Associations of Nepal (FWEAN), established in 2003, is a not-for-profit organization representing the collective efforts of women entrepreneurs in driving the economic progress of the nation and contributing to decision-making at both national and international levels. Guided by the vision of building the nation through the socio-economic empowerment of Nepali women, FWEAN works to strengthen the entrepreneurial ecosystem and create an enabling environment for both aspiring and existing women entrepreneurs.

As the apex body of the Women Entrepreneurs’ Association of Nepal (WEAN), FWEAN has a nationwide presence across all 77 districts, with 76 WEAN Chapters and the central FWEAN office in Kathmandu, along with FWEAN Province Committees in all seven provinces. The organization is anchored in its core values of Accountability, Ambition, Collaboration, and Creativity.

With a mission to inspire and empower women entrepreneurs and their enterprises, FWEAN’s work is centered around four key objectives:

  • To advocate on issues related to women’s economic empowerment
  • To enhance the capacity of women entrepreneurs
  • To support businesses of women entrepreneurs
  • To increase the outreach of FWEAN

JOB SCOPE

  • The Provincial Officer plays a critical role in strengthening the entrepreneurial ecosystem and enhancing the capacities of women entrepreneurs across the province. The position focuses on facilitating linkages between women-led enterprises, government institutions, private sector actors, and support organizations; improving access to Business Development Services (BDS); and fostering a conducive environment for women entrepreneurs to thrive.
  • The role requires strong technical expertise in enterprise development, proven coordination skills with provincial and local governments, and hands-on support to women entrepreneurs and their associations.

Key Responsibilities

A. Ecosystem Strengthening & Coordination

  • Facilitate effective coordination between provincial ministries, local governments, business associations, financial institutions, and private-sector stakeholders.
  • Map ecosystem actors and identify gaps in support mechanisms for women-led enterprises.
  • Advocate for gender-responsive policies, programs, and resource allocation at the provincial level.
  • Support the establishment and strengthening of platforms for dialogue between government, private sector, and women entrepreneurs.

B. Capacity Building of Women Entrepreneurs

  • Carry out needs assessments related to skills, market access, digital literacy, and financial literacy.
  • Facilitate and oversee training, mentorship sessions, coaching programs, and exposure visits.
  • Support women entrepreneurs in developing business plans, improving products and services, and adopting relevant digital tools.
  • Link women-led enterprises to BDS providers, financial institutions, and other support services.

C. Project Implementation & Technical Support

  • Support the rollout of project interventions at provincial and municipal levels.
  • Provide technical assistance in planning and organizing activities such as business clinics, bootcamps, networking events, trade fairs, and market linkage sessions.
  • Monitor field activities, ensure high-quality delivery, and troubleshoot implementation challenges.
  • Coordinate closely with municipal focal persons, implementing partners, and stakeholders to ensure smooth execution of activities.

D. Data, Monitoring & Reporting

  • Document best practices, success stories, challenges, and lessons learned from the field.
  • Maintain updated databases of women entrepreneurs, ecosystem actors, BDS providers, and institutions.
  • Prepare timely progress reports, field visit updates, and inputs for donor and management reporting.
  • Support MEL processes including surveys, assessments, data collection, and verification exercises.

E. Partnership Development

  • Strengthen collaborations with chambers, federations, business associations, cooperatives, and private-sector networks.
  • Facilitate partnerships with financial service providers, TVET institutions, incubators, accelerators, and market actors.
  • Identify opportunities to leverage resources and link entrepreneurs to provincial and federal programs, schemes, and support mechanisms.

Qualifications and Experience

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Development Studies, Economics, Gender Studies, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).
  • Minimum 3–5 years of experience in enterprise development, women’s economic empowerment, MSME support programs, or related fields.
  • Experience working with provincial and municipal governments in Nepal.
  • Strong understanding of the entrepreneurial ecosystem, private-sector development, and BDS services.
  • Excellent facilitation, coordination, and communication skills.
  • Willingness and ability to travel frequently within the province.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience working with women entrepreneurs and marginalized groups.
  • Knowledge of BDS, Market Systems Development (MSD), and gender-responsive programming.
  • Experience working in donor-funded projects (e.g., GIZ, UN agencies, INGOs).

Competencies

  • Strong problem-solving, analytical, and networking abilities.
  • Sensitivity to gender equality, social inclusion, and local contexts.
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks, work under pressure, and meet deadlines.
  • Proficiency in MS Office, digital tools, and data management platforms.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills in Nepali and English; knowledge of local languages is an asset.

TO APPLY

Persons meeting the above criteria are requested to send their updated CV and a cover letter answering the question “What past experiences will add value to this position?” Send your application as a single PDF document to info@fwean.org.np latest by 28 January 2026 before 5:00 pm.

The applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, so early applications are highly encouraged. Women and persons from marginalised communities are encouraged to apply. Only shortlisted candidates will be called for interviews. The start date is ASAP.

The Family Planning Association of Nepal (FPAN), established in 1959, is Nepal’s first national organization delivering family planning (FP) and sexual and reproductive health and rights (SRHR) services. A Member Association of the International Planned Parenthood Federation (IPPF) since 1969, FPAN is a key partner of the Government of Nepal’s national family planning programme, contributing a significant share of FP and reproductive health services annually. FPAN provides inclusive and essential SRH services through static clinics, outreach services, community-based distribution, and digital platforms. Its services prioritize poor, marginalized, socially excluded, and underserved (PMSEU) populations, including sex workers, people living with HIV, LGBTQI+ individuals, people who inject drugs, migrant workers, survivors of gender-based violence (GBV), persons with disabilities, and populations affected by disasters and humanitarian crises.

Position: District Agriculture Technician (12)

HERD International is a research and development agency dedicated to generating and utilizing evidence to improve the health and well-being of people. Our mission involves empowering individuals and communities through collaborative efforts with policy practitioners, researchers, and concerned stakeholders. We are committed to promoting evidence-informed and contextually tailored solutions to address local issues, strengthen systems, and establish best practices, with the ultimate goal of enhancing the quality of life.

HERD International is currently implementing the Darwin Extra Nepal Pollination Project: Upscaling Pollination to Enhance Biodiversity and Human Welfare in Nepal. In collaboration with national and international partners, this four-year project aims to address pollinator declines that threaten livelihoods and nutrition in the country. With learnings from our previous two projects (Micro-Poll and Darwin Main), we have proved that these trends can be reversed at a local scale, if farmers, researchers and policymakers work together. Scaling up in extent and ambition, we will deliver a national-level regime-shift in pollinator awareness, farming and beekeeping practices, research capacity, and conservation policy in Nepal, leading to healthier people, economies and ecosystems across the Himalayan region.

Working Location:

Gandaki Province: Mustang, Kaski, Lamjung, Syangja
Karnali Province: Surkhet, Jajarkot, Dailekh, Jumla
Lumbini Province: Kapilvastu, Dang, Palpa, Gulmi

Major Responsibilities:

1. Participate in the training on agroecosystem services, pollinator biodiversity and management, ecological data collection, teaching methods etc.
2. Coordinate with local government institutions, agricultural offices, health facilities, schools and community stakeholders as and when necessary
3. Take consent from the local organizations, schools, farmers, landowners, and other local stakeholders as and when necessary
4. Establish demonstration farms showcasing the evidence-based Pollinator Stewardship Scheme through cultivation of high-value pollinator-dependent crops
5. Create pollinator-friendly habitat and management practices on the farms and urban green spaces
6. Manage pollinator-friendly demonstration farms in accordance with the guidelines and manuals
7. Run weekly Farmer Field School (FFS) style sessions on demonstration farms to showcase and experiment with pollination management practices and traditional beekeeping
8. Administer study tools and collect valid data periodically, and record project indicators on model farms (biodiversity surveys, crop yield, visitor numbers, follow-up surveys etc.)
9. Share local case studies, local farming practices, pollinator pictures, pollinator-themed art and conservation/ management tips to the project team
10. Strictly follow the guidelines, manuals and operational definitions of the technical terms referred in the tools prepared by the project team
11. Report any adverse event related to project activities and other field-level difficulties to managers
12. Participate in the regular monthly meeting at the district office
13. Maintain professional and research ethics throughout job tenure
14. Record the collected data (both in paper and digital form) and daily submission in server
15. Report daily status, and monthly processes (monthly process document/ timesheet/ report)
16. Support district team as per required in various district and field-level activities
17. Safely use and protect the project tools and equipment from damage/ loss
18. Strictly adhere to the norms and rules of HERD International during the contract period

Must have:

1. Intermediate in Agriculture with minimum 2-year experience, or Pre-Diploma (JT/JTA) in Agriculture with 5 years of experience
2. Experience in a rural setting with exposure to agriculture-based research and development projects
3. Written and verbal communication skills in both Nepali and English.
4. Residency in the project implementation district, or prior work experience in the district.
5. Candidates holding a valid motorbike/scooter driving license will be given priority

Instructions for applying:

Interested and qualified individuals are requested to use the below link for the application to be completed by February 1, 2026.

Online Application Form

Fill out the online application form and attach your latest CV and a Cover letter.

Only short-listed candidates will be invited to participate in an assessment process. Any effort to influence the selection process will result in disqualification.

We encourage applications from women and people from diverse groups across ethnicity and geography.

  • the ability to think logically
  • a good memory of how software and operating systems work
  • excellent listening and questioning skills, combined with the ability to interact confidently with clients to establish what the problem is and explain the solution
  • the ability to work well in a team
  • problem solving skills
  • a strong customer focus
  • the ability to prioritize your workload
  • Attention to detail.

Job Duties & Responsibilities:

Job Description:

  • AGENT, shall review and maintain all corporate and consumer clients’ internet connectivity and help review computer systems, systems network of clients and suggest solutions by coordinating with desktop support if required. AGENT Field shall be helping and assisting all corporate field agents on technical and other issues.
  • AGENT, shall also work within first or second-line support. The work is as much about understanding how information systems are used as applying technical knowledge related to Internet, fiber connectivity, LAN/WAN, computer hardware or software and networking systems.

Responsibilities

AGENT are mainly responsible for reporting the Corporate Field Support tasks on daily basis. AGENT shall be responsible for containing and corresponding with all the corporate clients FV tasks of the day and provide update to clients.

  • The AGENT shall ensure that all corporate FVs are accounted for the day. All corporate visits shall be properly diagnosed with proper solutions. Upon any exceptions the clients shall be informed.
  • Install and operate full internet connectivity at clients site
  • monitor and maintain computer systems and networks of the clients and Vianet
  • Provide technical assistance to marketing agent to acquire new installations.
  • talk to staff or clients through a series of actions, either face-to-face or over the phone, to help set up internet systems or resolve issues or provide solutions
  • Troubleshoot system and network problems, diagnosing and solving hardware, internet or software faults.
  • replace equipment/parts as required
  • provide support, including procedural documentation and relevant reports
  • follow diagrams and written instructions to repair a fault or set up a system
  • support the roll-out of new applications
  • respond within agreed time limits to call-outs
  • work continuously on a task until completion (or referral to third parties, if appropriate)
  • prioritize and manage many open cases at one time
  • rapidly establish a good working relationship with customers and other professionals, such as software developers
  • test and evaluate new technology
  • Engage in proactive visits of corporate customer’s weekly/monthly.
  • Provide monthly report on works done.

Reporting:

  • The report shall be send on daily basis on the following tasks:
  • Proactive Follow up
  • Desk top Support
  • FV Support with forms
  • Installation Visits with clients internal network
  • Any trainings
  • Daily Activities

Position: Driver
Location: Kathmandu

The Driver is responsible to drive Ipas Nepal’s vehicle and ensure that the vehicle is in proper condition. S/he should ensure cleanliness of the vehicle on daily basis and oversee routine maintenance and servicing of the vehicle.

Driving Services

  • Provide safe and reliable driving services for Ipas staff within city areas and outside the Kathmandu Valley, as required.
  • Ensure the internal and external cleanliness of vehicles and motorbikes at all times.
  • Ensure adequate fuel availability in vehicles for daily operations.
  • Use the shortest, safest, and most efficient routes, avoiding unnecessary mileage and time.
  • Conduct daily vehicle condition checks, including brakes, lights, indicators, radiator, battery, tire pressure, engine oil (mobil), fuel level, and overall roadworthiness.
  • Provide pick-up and drop-off services for staff, visitors, and guests as requested by the office.
  • Coordinate with the security focal point and traffic control prior to starting trips, when required.
  • Strictly follow traffic rules, organizational norms, and Ipas values at all times.
  • In the event of an accident, follow established procedures, immediately notify the supervisor/office, and provide necessary assistance.
  • Ensure the vehicle is equipped with all required safety tools, including a toolbox, safety items, and a fully stocked first-aid kit.
  • Follow up on regular servicing of vehicles and motorbikes at reputable service outlets, including timely replacement of parts such as air filters, engine oil, and other required components.
  • Maintain accurate records of fuel refueling, repairs, maintenance, and parts replacement in the vehicle logbook.
  • Complete and submit Ipas standard travel logs promptly after each trip.
  • Ensure timely renewal of vehicle and motorbike documents, including blue books, pollution checks (green stickers), and other regulatory requirements.
  • Follow up on provincial motorbike blue book renewals in compliance with applicable legislation.
  • Monitor and calculate fuel consumption and mileage, ensuring proper documentation and comparison through logbooks.

Administrative Support

  • Provide support for photocopying, scanning, binding, and replacement of toner/cartridges for photocopiers and printers.
  • Offer logistical support for workshops, meetings, trainings, and seminars.
  • Handle errands with banks, NTC, drinking water offices, CIT, PF, SSF, tax offices, and other relevant institutions for official transactions.
  • Deliver and collect official documents, letters, parcels, pouches, and other materials to and from partner organizations, government offices, donors, and vendors.
  • Receive incoming phone calls and relay messages in the absence of the receptionist.
  • Support store operations, including physical verification of items, preparation, packing, and timely placement of materials as required.
  • Understand and comply with the organization policies and ethics
  • Understand and comply with the Human Resources, Procurement, Travel, Finance Policy, and other policies of the organization.
  • Commitment and adherence to the Ipas code of business ethics and conduct and safeguarding policy.
  • Ensure Ipas representatives (including consultants, interns, volunteers, independent contractors, suppliers/vendors, board members, sub-awardees) and government officials directly working with Ipas and its partners understand and practice the prevention of sexual exploitation and abuse policy while in partnership and implement program with Ipas.
  • Contribute to safe working environment where every team member is treated equally and respectfully.
  • Live up to the Ipas core values driven, principled, bold, interdependent.
  • Ensure all work activities comply with the organization rules and regulations
  • Ensure proper documentation of memo’s, decisions, reports and any official documents for record keeping hardcopy/OneDrive/Luna as appropriate.

PSEA compliance

  • As an Ipas Nepal employee read, understand, and sign the acknowledgement to comply with all aspects of the PSEA as defined by the PSEA policy.
  • Contribute to safe working environment where every team member is treated equally and respectfully.
  • Ensure Ipas representatives (including consultants, interns, volunteers, independent contractors, suppliers/vendors, board members, sub-awardees) and government officials directly working with Ipas and its partners understand and practice the prevention of sexual exploitation and abuse policy while in partnership and implement program with Ipas.

Other responsibilities

  • Engage in a learning culture and participate and enrol learning courses of Ipas University.
  • Willing to be back up for staff and vacant positions and perform other related duties as required.

    Ipas is strongly committed to providing a work environment that is free from all forms of harassment, discrimination, and inequity. We recruit, employ, train, promote, and compensate our personnel without regard to race, age, sex, religion, national origin, color, creed, ancestry, citizenship, caste, ethnicity, regional identity, tribal identity, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, gender identity, transgender status, sexual orientation, or any other personal characteristic protected by law or outlined by Ipas policy. Ipas acknowledges that these personal characteristics may differ in different contexts.

PHASE Nepal is a non-governmental, organization established in 2006 with a vision to build a self-empowered and self-sustained society where all kinds of discrimination are absent (please visit www.phasenepal.org for more information). PHASE Nepal’s health, education, livelihoods and research projects are currently running across various rural communities in Nepal. With support from Himalayan Development Foundation Australia (HDFA), PHASE Nepal is implementing education project in two government schools in Phaktanglung Rural Municipality in Taplejung district with the aim of improving quality of education in close collaboration with the Municipality.

We are seeking highly motivated candidates with a good academic background and experienced teaching/mentoring aiming to improve the quality of education.

Position: Teacher

Number of positions: 2 Positions [One for Science and One for English]

Duration: 1 year with possibility of extension

Duty Station: Saraswati Chyabruk Secondary School and Sinwa Secondary School, Phaktanglung Rural Municipality, Taplejung district, Nepal

Report to: Project Manager/Program Manager

Salary and Benefits per month (NRs.):

DELIVERABLE GOALS: MAIN TASKS, DUTIES, AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Provide in-class mentoring and support to respective subject teachers teaching English, Science, and Mathematics (Grades 4–10).
  • Groom, mentor, and train the teachers of Saraswati Chyabruk Secondary School and Sinwa Secondary School to strengthen teaching practices and classroom delivery following student centered activity-based teaching methods.
  • Take classes on where appropriate, especially when subject teachers are absent to demonstrate effective teaching methodologies and support student learning.
  • Support integration skills such as but not limited to, Creativity, Collaboration, Critical Thinking, and Communication — in classroom teaching.
  • Assist in preparing lesson plans, session plans, developing innovative teaching materials, and creating engaging learning environments.
  • Facilitate academic and co-curricular activities to promote holistic student development.
  • Maintain student assessment records and report progress to school stakeholders.
  • Support implementation of the School Improvement Plan under the supervision of the Principal and SMC.
  • Coordinate and collaborate with school staff, parents, and local stakeholders for continuous improvement.
  • Facilitate workshops, training sessions, and discussions to enhance teaching quality.
  • Promote digital learning and child-friendly, inclusive classroom practices.
  • Perform other duties as assigned by the Project Manager or school leadership.

JOB REQUIREMENTS/ REQUIRED PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Education specializing in English, or Science.
  • Minimum of 5 years of teaching experience in secondary education, with a strong understanding of subject-specific pedagogy and classroom practices. Experience in rural or under-resourced settings will be an advantage.
  • Deep understanding of child psychology, classroom management, and effective curriculum delivery.
  • Proficiency in digital tools and communication technologies to enhance teaching and learning.
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills.
  • Patient, empathetic, adaptable, and willing to work in rural areas with minimal facilities.
  • Demonstrated passion for teaching, mentoring, and continuous professional development.

Other benefits

PHASE Nepal will provide accidental insurance of NRs. 20,00,000/- for employee and medical insurance of NRs. 2,25,000/- that covers the employee and his/her up to 2 dependent family members.

How to Apply:

Interested candidates who meet the above-mentioned criteria are requested to submit their application by filling the form through the link https://ee-eu.kobotoolbox.org/x/Doljxx6Y no later than 25 January 2026. PHASE reserves the right to qualify/disqualify applications in any case.

We are urgently looking for these positions; therefore, we will close the application if we find appropriate candidates before the application deadline. Therefore, apply as soon as possible if you are interested.

PHASE Nepal is an equal opportunity employer and strictly follows merit-based selection. Suitably qualified local candidates, women, people with disability, and members from disadvantaged communities are strongly encouraged to apply. Only shortlisted candidates will be called for the further selection process.

No telephone inquiries will be entertained, and any inappropriate recommendation will automatically disqualify the candidate from further selection process

Aasaman Nepal is implementing SRHR and Gender equality/Empowered Women Prosperous Nepal (EWPN) including ending child marriage and harmful practices Programs in Madhesh Province in the partnership with UNFPA.

The overarching objectives of the programs are to enhance reproductive health outcomes, eliminate gender-based violence, empower women economically and socially, and reduce child marriage. The integrated approach aims to provide comprehensive reproductive health services, promote gender equity, facilitate women’s economic empowerment through skill development and entrepreneurship, and contribute to the global effort of ending child marriage. The program collectively strives to create a society where individuals, particularly women and adolescents, have the knowledge, resources, and opportunities to make informed decisions about their health, well-being, and future. Aasaman Nepal is looking for the self-motivated, result oriented and hard-working Nepali citizen for the following position:

Entrepreneurship Development facilitator – Nos: One (Based in Saptari District)

The Entrepreneurship Development facilitator will support to provide basic career counseling and tailored business development counselling and guidance to GBV survivors, other beneficiaries of the program and the GBV Service providers supported under the UNFPA-EWPN program. The facilitator will guide, mentor, and support beneficiaries through continuous career counseling and guidance, business development coaching, monitoring, effective utilization of seed funds, and sustainable economic empowerment with a survivor-centered and gender-responsive approach.

Objective

To support survivors and project beneficiaries in planning, launching, and strengthening profitable and sustainable enterprises through career guidance and counselling, coaching, monitoring of seed fund utilization, employment enrollment and facilitation of market and service linkages.

Scope of Work

The Entrepreneurship Development facilitator will work closely with survivors at the field level, and provide continuous career counseling and guidance, business development coaching, monitoring, and coordination with relevant stakeholders to ensure sustainable business outcomes. This Role will also closely coordinate with Business Coach deployed within EWPN program and other relevant partners of EWPN, Employment Service Centres, Enterprise development facilitators of local government and other relevant service providers.

Key Responsibilities

Career Guidance and Counselling

  • Provide one to one and group based career guidance and counselling sessions to GBV survivors (in close coordination with the service providers and counselors), focusing on self assessment, career exploration, informed decision making and realistic livelihood planning.
  • Support survivors to identify suitable livelihood pathways, including wage employment, skills training, apprenticeships, entrepreneurship (through referrals) or further education.
  • Develop individualized career action plans in collaboration with survivors that are to be aligned with safety considerations and survivor preferences.
  • Offer mentoring and motivational support throughout the program period in regards to shaping their career interest in selection of any entrepreneurship or employment
  • Link with available employment and self-employment supports through information sharing and needful coordination.

Capacity Building of GBV Service Providers

  • Deliver basic training sessions for GBV service providers, including safe house staff, on foundational career guidance and counselling skills.
  • Develop simple tools, guidance notes and referral checklists to support survivors/frontline workers on GBV in providing basic career counselling.
  • Coordinate with local stakeholders and support agencies.

Coordination and Referral

  • Coordinate with other EWPN PUNOs expertise to ensure seamless referrals for survivors opting for enterprise development support.
  • Establish and maintain referral linkages with vocational training providers, employers, cooperatives, education institutions, and government livelihood program.
  • Work closely with program staff to integrate career guidance within GBV response and economic empowerment services.
  • Closely coordinate with Business Development Counsellor and other relevant partners of EWPN, Employment Service Centers, Enterprise development facilitators of local government and other relevant service providers for mapping of available opportunities (wage employment, skill training, start-up supports, etc.) and referral.

Monitoring, Documentation and Reporting

  • Maintain accurate records of career guidance sessions, referrals made, training conducted and follow up outcomes.
  • Track survivor progress along selected livelihood pathways and provide follow up support as needed.
  • Prepare monthly, quarterly, and final reports highlighting activities, outcomes, challenges, lessons learned, and success stories.
  • Support documentation of case studies, best practices, and learning materials for program knowledge sharing.

Other Responsibilities

  • Uphold survivor center, gender responsive, and do no harm principles in all interventions.
  • Perform other duties of a similar level as assigned by Aasaman Nepal and the Project Team.

Required Qualifications and Experience

  • Intermediate level qualification, preferably a Bachelor’s degree in Social Work, Economics, or a related field; NSTB-certified Enterprise Development Facilitator (EDF) Level 2 or 3 will be considered an added advantage.
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in business development support, enterprise facilitation, market linkage, and business plan preparation.
  • Experience working with rural women, survivors, or marginalized communities is highly preferred.
  • Good understanding of gender-responsive business development and survivor-centered support approaches.
  • Strong communication, counselling, networking, analytical, and reporting skills.
  • Proficiency in English with good digital literacy skills, candidates speaking the local language will be an advantage.
  • Two-wheeler license required

Reporting Line: Direct Report to: Program Coordinator-EWPN and GBV officer

Duty Station and Travel: Based at the Saptari District with frequent field visits to beneficiary locations under EWPN program. Close coordination with EWPN all funding partners.

Duration: Five months Period (February 2026 to June 2026) with possibility of extension based of funds available.

Languages: Strong command of Nepali, English, Maithili, Bhojpuri (oral and written) and local language preferred/required.

Aasaman Nepal has zero tolerance of abuse and exploitation of vulnerable people. We expect all our employees/volunteers to ensure we are protecting children, young people and vulnerable adults from harm and abide by our safeguarding policy.

Other Attributes for all positions: Excellent quality of work and commitment to high standards, strong communication skills, team building and willingness and motivated for good service delivery with strong networking and interpersonal skills and comfortable to work under stress and emergencies.

Age Limit: Candidates between 18 years to 40 years are only eligible to apply for the above position, depending upon the nature of job they will carry.

All employees must adhere to child safeguarding in person’s provisions covered in the project agreement.

Monitor staff and partners’ and ensure adherence to Aasaman Nepal’s policies and internal procedures, protocols, Aasaman Nepal’s code of Conduct with special attention to Safeguarding Standards and Procedure, Case Handling Framework, Child Protection and Do No Harm Policies. Also, immediate reporting and redress of any complaints and issues based on its severity.

Notes:

  • Locals, especially women and members of ethnic or marginalized communities from Madhesh Province are encouraged to apply for this position.
  • Applications received after the deadline will not be considered and only shortlisted candidates will be notified for the further process.
  • Canvassing at any stage of the recruitment process shall lead to automatic disqualification of the candidate.

Interested candidates are requested to submit their application filled by downloading the link below along with an updated CV and Cover Letter by 25/01/2026.

https://forms.gle/VgSSMBT56FYsdtMb8

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for participation in the recruitment process. No telephone enquiry is entertained. ASN reserves the right to qualify/disqualify any applications without any reason.

Position: Relationship Officer

Summary

This job role primarily involves assisting in the preparation of business proposals and client agreements, while ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements. Prospect candidate needs to gather and analyze financial data, conduct company valuations, and develop financial models to support investment decisions.

Key Duties & Responsibilities:

  •  Assist in preparing the proposal and forward to the potential client for corporate advisory.
  • Assist in preparing & signing of the agreement with the Client Company.
  • Collect charter documents, financial data and other relevant information and documents from the Client Company and safe keep the documents received.
  •  Assist in analyzing financial data, charter documents of the Client Company.
  • Assist in preparing financial modelling, projection and valuation of the client company.
  • Assist with industry and market research and analysis.
  •  Assist in preparing various report such as feasibility reports, investment memorandum and pitch deck etc.
  • Arrange meetings with stakeholders.
  • Send claims and follow up regularly for the settlement.
  •  Other necessary tasks as required.

Expected Skills/ Experience/Knowledge

  •  Possesses good command over Microsoft Excel and basic working knowledge of other MS Applications.
  • Possesses strong verbal & written communication, interpersonal and persuasion skills.
  • Ability to perform valuation of business and interpretation of financial statements.
  •  Knowledge of different financial instruments and their usage in capital and money markets.
  • Possesses good analytical skills.
  •  Ability to manage a varied workload and multiple concurrent projects
  • Team player, self-driven, results-oriented with a positive outlook.
  • Attention to detail.

Eligibility Criteria

  • Master’s degree in Finance/ Management with relevant work experience or Bachelor’s degree with 3 years of experience in related field. Candidates pursuing or having professional degree such as CA/ACCA/CFA will be preferred.
  • Should have minimum first division or CGPA 3.00 on a scale of 4 from recognized university.
  • Age should not exceed 35 years as on 27th January, 2026.

Application ends January 27, 2026

title.rendered: Enterprise Development Coordinator, Enterprise Development Officer

content.rendered:
Association for Social Transformation and Humanitarians Assistance (ASTHA Nepal), was established on 1996 with the objective to contribute to the socioeconomic transformation of the country for the up liftmen of living standard of rural people by enhancing their awareness on socio-economic, cultural and environmental issues through various development programs related to awareness raising, entrepreneurship development, community infrastructure development, environment protection, skill development and sustainable development of natural systems. The rationale behind the inception of ASTHA is the realization that the problems of poverty and rural backwardness cannot be addressed through efforts of the government alone and complementary programs and initiatives should come from the non-governmental sector as well. The basic purpose of ASTHA, therefore, is to work with the poor, Dalits, indigenous, and disadvantaged people, and their organizations/groups at the grassroots level as a mechanism for enhancing their capacity for rural development.

ASTHA Nepal is recruiting young, energetic, and motivated candidates for a new project to be implemented in Sudurpachhim Province and Karnali Province.

Position: Enterprise Development Coordinator

Location: Sudurpachhim Province and Karnali Province.

No. of Vacancy/s: [1]

Education and Experience:

  • Master’s degree in Business Administration, Business Management, Enterprise Development, or a closely related discipline.
  • At least 7 years of relevant professional experience in enterprise development, including business process improvement, business plan preparation, marketing, value chain development, and access to financial services.
  • Proven experience in planning, implementing, coordinating, and monitoring projects that support enterprise creation and promotion.
  • Practical experience working closely with government officials and local governments (rural and urban Palikas).
  • Strong understanding of the challenges and opportunities of rural agri-based enterprises, particularly small and emerging businesses.
  • Demonstrated experience in addressing access to finance issues for rural agri-based enterprises.
  • Good knowledge of blended financing approaches and hands-on experience applying such tools in similar contexts.
  • Solid understanding of business linkages and value chain development.
  • Openness to change, with the ability to receive and effectively integrate feedback.
  • Good understanding and prior experience in gender sensitivity and GESI mainstreaming.
  • Strong analytical, report writing, communication, and presentation skills in both English and Nepali.

Position: Enterprise Development Officer

Location: Sudurpachhim Province and Karnali Province.

No. of Vacancy/s: [2]

Education and Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Development, Business Management, Enterprise Development, or a closely related field.
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in enterprise development, including business processes, business plan preparation, agriculture marketing, and value chain development.
  • Experience in planning, implementing, coordinating, and monitoring projects that support the creation and promotion of rural and small enterprises.
  • Strong experience in promoting rural and small-scale enterprises.
  • Good understanding of social mobilization approaches before and after enterprise establishment.
  • Ability to train, mentor, and coach entrepreneurs throughout different stages of the enterprise life cycle.
  • Proven ability to guide and support business plan preparation for agri-based enterprises in rural settings.
  • Strong understanding of local and regional market systems, including B2B linkages.
  • Good knowledge of marketing strategies suitable for small farmers and rural enterprises.
  • Prior experience and understanding of gender sensitivity and GESI mainstreaming.
  • Proficiency in computer applications, especially MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
  • Strong interpersonal, teamwork, and organizational skills.

HOW TO APPLY

Potential candidates are invited to apply by submitting an application letter indicating the position, along with an updated CV including contact information for two referees. Applications should be sent to astha.vacancy@gmail.com and must be received no later than 21st January 2026. ASTHA NEPAL encourages a diverse workforce and practices affirmative action in favor of candidates from Women, Dalits, Janajati, Madhesi and people with disabilities. Individuals from these backgrounds are strongly encouraged to apply. ASTHA NEPAL retains the right to cancel, postpone, or modify the entire recruitment process without the obligation to provide any specific reasons.

For more information, please visit: www.asthanepal.com.np

Position: MCC Manager

Department: Maintenance & Engineering

Vacancy Code: H9/M&E/0012026

Required No.: 01

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Maintain acceptable airworthiness, safety and performance standards in H9 aircraft fleet A320/A319
  • Ensure that aircraft maintenance is in compliance with the requirements of NCAR-145
  • Train technicians in A320 aircraft maintenance, safety, human factor etc.
  • Accomplish production, maintenance and inspection tasks as delegated by optimum use of manpower and resources in the most efficient and cost-effective manner.
  • Assist M&E Department in Maintenance, Trouble-Shooting & Defect Analysis

Qualification Requirements

  • Holder of Aeronautical or appropriate Engineering Degree and minimum 5 years of work experience in Engineering Department. (Preferably with A320 Family)
  • Licensed AME with CAAN AMT  License or equivalent in Ratings: A320/A321/A319 CFM56, A320/A321/A319 (V2500)
  • Priority will be given for additional license on B737-600/700/800 (CFM56), B777-200/300 (GE90), B777-200/300 (PW4000), A330-200/300 (Trent700), A330-200/300 (PW4000)
  • Capable of planning under guidance of  Maintenance Manager, for man-power/man-hour/ tools/ equipment/ spares/materials management
  • Able to handle all major and minor maintenance activities in advance coordinating with CAMO, Engineering Stores, Material Procurement, Operations and Marketing
  • Knowledge of NCAR Part 145, NCAR Part 66, NCAR Part M, NCAR Part 147, MOE, FTS, EWIS, CDCCL, SMS, Human factor principles & Type training

Please fill-up the form & upload your updated resume, a copy of pp size photo, scanned copy (ies) of your qualifications & copy of citizenship etc. using the links: https://forms.gle/1LCawemCyDLKzFQPA not later than 15 days from the date of publication. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Phone calls will not be entertained.

PHASE Nepal is a not for profit NGO established in 2006 by a group of development professionals dedicated to supporting poor communities in Humla, Bajura, Mugu, Gorkha, Kathmandu, and Sindhupalchok districts of Nepal. For the last 19 years, PHASE Nepal has been improving the livelihoods of rural people by providing immediate support through health care and education services and create opportunities in communities for self-empowerment. Currently, PHASE Nepal’s projects on health, education, and livelihoods are funded by a number of institutional and individual donors from different countries. We also implement various research projects in partnership with different universities from the UK and organizations from other Asian and African countries. PHASE Nepal is currently looking for suitable candidates for the following position:

Position: Auxiliary Nurse Midwife (ANM)

Duty Station: PHASE Nepal project locations in Humla, Mugu, and Bajura,

REQUIRED NUMBER: Few

DESIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Completed ANM course from a recognized institution and registered in the Nepal Nursing Council.
  • At least 2 years of work experience in community health programs.
  • Candidates who have worked independently in the government health-posts or independently running health post will be given high priority.
  • Good written and spoken Nepali language.
  • Ability to adapt to living and working in a remote location as well as flexibility to be redeployed, as required, to another project areas of PHASE Nepal.
  • Willingness to learn the basic local languages to communicate with the local community.
  • Ability to convince community people for healthy life style, improved sanitation etc.
  • Ability to share project information with larger audience, such as group meetings, from the community and not showing fear, arrogance and or nervousness.
  • High degree of motivation to work in the remote areas. Highly honest, reliable and confident and having great learning attitude.
  • A good learner and able to work in a team, alone and/or without supervision.
  • Candidates who have received SBA training and handled number of delivery cases on their own will be given priority.

Salary and Benefits per month (NRS)

*The food and field allowance may vary depending on the location.

Insurance Benefits:

We also offer Medical Insurance of Rs. 2,25,000/- that covers employee and his/her dependent family members up to two, and Accidental Insurance of Rs. 2,000,000/-.

How to Apply:

Interested candidates who meet the above-mentioned criteria is request to submit their application by filling the form through the link https://ee-eu.kobotoolbox.org/x/KVXElU3X no later than 24 January 2026. PHASE reserves the right to qualify/disqualify applications in any case

PHASE Nepal is an equal opportunities employer and strictly follows merit-based selection. PHASE reserves the right to qualify/disqualify applications in any case.

Only shortlisted candidates will be called for the further selection process.

No telephone inquiries will be entertained and any inappropriate recommendation will automatically disqualify the candidate for further selection process
